page.title: 09PLACE NAMES 7
page.content: {CONCLUSIONS WHICH MAY BE DRAWN {______________________________ It can be seen that in this area around Lartington there are a number of influences in the place names. Many come from Old English, but there are{ some personal names and a great many come from the Norse. { {Personal Names : }These usually describe land owned by somebody, often these names have an element which tell us something about the type of land. A good example of this is Osmonflat which is obviously the flat land owned by a Mr. Osmon. { {Old English Names :}There are many Old English names in the area, eg 'sike', 'lance' and words with a 'was' component.
